title: URF MODE: Where Every Champ is OP As Fuq
body:
Please post any champions you have played and why you feel they are OP. I'll start, since I only played three games:

{{champion:17}}  
1. 20 Shrooms
2. MARKSMAN so much faster autos which apply poison
3. Q is up every 2 seconds so if you keep spamming Q the enemy can NEVER AUTO ATTACK YOU. Let that sink in a bit.

{{champion:11}} 
1. Q is up every 1.5 seconds or so and allows you not only to deal AOE damage but to dodge EVERYTHING, even tower shots
2. If you get a single kill or assist, your R is ALWAYS up. ALWAYS. Did I say ALWAYS?
3. No mana so free heals/shields VERY often

{{champion:1}} 
1. Stun is up every 2 seconds with rotation spam. As close to perma stun as you can get in this mode.
2. Tibbers if not killed is ALWAYS up since he is on a 24 second CD and lasts for 45 seconds...you do the math.
3. With flash up every minute she has possibly the best engage in the game now.

replies.body:
I'll go. Surprisingly WEAK champion in URF: {{champion:75}} 

1. While Q is always up, you can never farm with it since enemy has non stop harass
2. Tanky builds are "meh" in URF since every can spam abilities and get pen items quicker
3. See 1. Without Q Nasus is poop.
Ah, but did you try AP Nasus? Played against one that did rather well yesterday.

> [{quoted}](name=Zirzon,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=00000003,timestamp=2015-04-02T13:58:30.114+0000)
>
> Ah, but did you try AP Nasus? Played against one that did rather well yesterday.

Terrible idea. Two good spells, your strongest ability is worthless.
Actually if you build {{item:3100}} you shred towers and your E is great

i've had the exact opposite experience.  the early laning phase is tough, no doubt.  but i've found laning phase ends pretty quickly as people like to fight fight fight.  losing your first tower just makes it easier to farm, and after a few levels, farming jungle is pretty simple.  i just went pure tank and relied on my massively stacked Q.
I've had a lot of luck with Udyr in URF, even had the 12-0-6 no death dream. Though I build damage with tiger stance and not tank, so that may have something to do with it.

11/0/25 Nami  :)

I supported my buddy playing Jax; with my heals he was able to do incredibly stupid things and come out with double kills.
yeah tiger's the way to go.  endless DOT.
{{champion:30}}  suffers a bit because the cooldowns don't really help his abilities at all.  Except his ult. No one forgets about that bad boy.

You're kidding right?

Karthus Q now fires faster than a machine gun.

A MACHINE GUN.

W doesnt use mana.

ENDLESS W
Apologies,  I was using the 2014 URF version of him as a reference.  Didn't know they fixed him up a bit.
It's fine i was just pointing out the OP parts XD
I farmed 700 stacks in 20 mins with nasus and crushed everyone.

Man I picked {{champion:75}} into urf mode thinking "My Q will always be up so I can get 1000 stacks in 20 minutes".

Of course I forgot all about there being an enemy laner. And oh man, Nasus in urf is weak. Once you max Q every basic attack becomes a siphoning strike, which is actually quite funny, problem was that there was no real weight behind my Q's because I could never farm.

What is funny though is that you can perma-wither a single opponent and also wither multiple people at once, so you can actually win certain matchups because they are withered the entire laning phase.
Why is no one playing AP NASUS. Fuck his Q.
{{champion:31}}  silence, knock up and burst for those pesky squishy, sustaining blinking champions.  W-Q-W-R combo destroys everyone.  Your Q is off cooldown before it even erupts.
And the slow's still long enough that it'll erupt *again* before they can move out of the circle of the first one.

Being OP in URF is a given, but Wukong stands out above the rest for being nigh unkillable. He uses clone every two seconds, rendering most skills useless. I think AP Nasus isn the only other champ I've had problems with, but at least I can hit him.

> [{quoted}](name=BronzeVOnly,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-04-02T12:16:49.083+0000)
>
> Please post any champions you have played and why you feel they are OP. I'll start, since I only played three games:
> 
> {{champion:17}}  
> 1. 20 Shrooms
> 2. MARKSMAN so much faster autos which apply poison
> 3. Q is up every 2 seconds so if you keep spamming Q the enemy can NEVER AUTO ATTACK YOU. Let that sink in a bit.

Read the ability closer in URF. They took away the blinding part of his dart. He is mostly useless in this mode without that. Would have been nice if Riot has posted the list of "balance" changes they made so one wouldnt have to waste an entire game with a champion because they were ruined in the mode, but Riot felt better not to tell anyone.

> [{quoted}](name=GnomeDigest,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-04-02T16:09:38.906+0000)
>
> Read the ability closer in URF. They took away the blinding part of his dart. He is mostly useless in this mode without that.

SO THAT'S WHY MY BLIND WASN'T WORKING!

> [{quoted}](name=GnomeDigest,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2015-04-02T16:09:38.906+0000)
>
> Read the ability closer in URF. They took away the blinding part of his dart. He is mostly useless in this mode without that. Would have been nice if Riot has posted the list of "balance" changes they made so one wouldnt have to waste an entire game with a champion because they were ruined in the mode, but Riot felt better not to tell anyone.

[But they did post it](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/urf-rising).

And this is all it says for Teemo:

> THERE'S NOT MUSHROOM IN HERE Number of active mushrooms capped at 20

Which would explain why Teemos have been blinding me in the games I've played so far.

> [{quoted}](name=Jubbinaut,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=00070001,timestamp=2015-04-02T16:16:35.923+0000)
>
> [But they did post it](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/urf-rising).
> 
> And this is all it says for Teemo:
> 
> Which would explain why Teemos have been blinding me in the games I've played so far.

They posted Teemo but the blind removal is not there and its most definitely removed. Read the tooltip for blinding dart in URF. The blind part is gone. They havent been blinding you. You apparently just cant tell whats going on in the games you play.

> [{quoted}](name=GnomeDigest,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=000700010000,timestamp=2015-04-02T16:24:21.273+0000)
>
> They posted Teemo but the blind removal is not there and its most definitely removed. Read the tooltip for blinding dart in URF. The blind part is gone. They havent been blinding you. You apparently just cant tell whats going on in the games you play.

While I appreciate being patronized as much as the next person, I'm also pretty sure I'm capable of seeing and reading the word "miss" when I auto-attack after being hit by a Teemo - something I saw quite a few times last night.

I'm also pretty sure I'm capable of recognizing the blind debuff symbol under my health bar - something *else* I saw quite a few times last night.

> [{quoted}](name=Jubbinaut,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=0007000100000000,timestamp=2015-04-02T16:31:56.328+0000)
>
> While I appreciate being patronized as much as the next person, I'm also pretty sure I'm capable of seeing and reading the word "miss" when I auto-attack after being hit by a Teemo - something I saw quite a few times last night.
> 
> I'm also pretty sure I'm capable of recognizing the blind debuff symbol under my health bar - something *else* I saw quite a few times last night.

There is already another person in this thread saying "no wonder my blind didnt work". You might want to re-evaluate what it is you are "pretty sure about" going forward.

Oh. Good. Glad to know that the word of that random person is more meaningful than the word of *this* random person.

Even better to know that since that random person agreed with you, I must be delusional.

I know how to tell when I've been debuffed. I know how to tell what debuff it was. I know what the consequences of those debuffs are. I was blinded, repeatedly, by the [Teemo](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1780084647/203549820?tab=overview) I was laning against. Of course, given Cho's auto speed, it barely lasted more than two autos at a time, but it happened.

EDIT: If I'm doing my math right (and I'm not at all sure I've got the ccr calculations right) at rank 1, it only lasted ~0.6 seconds, and at rank 5, ~1.0 seconds. Which wasn't much of an impact on me, but was still present.

Teemo's blind does work you plebian

The problem is the blind status effect itself is bugged, and always has been (See Quinn)

So when you spam Q, It resets the blind timer, which ALWAYS lets the first auto attack hit you, meaning you keep unblinding them when you spam

lrnurshitm8

Sion is not OP.
Braum is not OP.
Draven is unseen.
Gnar is definitely not OP.
Bard is sure as hell not OP.
Not every champ is op for example {{champion:27}} JUST DO NOT PICK HIM IN URF
I just played with a Singed that did pretty well
and ur score was what exactly and did you win?

[Here's the game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1780677770/203721172?tab=overview)

Singed's score doesn't really do him justice, though he had the least deaths in the game (plus singed isn't necessarily going to have the best kda in a regular game anyways). He took like every tower in the game, and if you look at the statistics, he was putting out more damage than most players.

{{champion:110}} Use the Legolas build
{{champion:8}} That's MY health now
{{champion:37}} heals and Q damage for days
{{champion:83}} no more mana gating
{{champion:90}} Go AD and eat towers
{{champion:3}} You clear waves instantly and you have synergy with {{item:3512}} {{item:3060}} 
{{champion:35}} Boxes everywhere
{{champion:84}} permastealth
{{champion:6}} Q spam
{{champion:101}} Spam spells from base
{{champion:76}} obviously
{{champion:81}} kite forever
{{champion:98}} Haven't gotten a shot at the current URF, but I remember going 1v5 with him and getting out with a kill multiple times.  A taunt, a shield and a heal make for a potent combination.

Of the champions I've played?
I'll avoid the obvious ones ({{champion:76}}, AP {{champion:53}}, AP + Spellvamp {{champion:28}} )

{{champion:89}} 

* Most people favor range/poke in this gamemode, thus the natural counter is hard engage.
* Between your E and Q (and ult), you can have someone CC locked by yourself indefinitely.
* Your W is up permanently; gives you a lot of AoE damage. Your ult is on like a 15 second cooldown
* Increased gold gain means you get ridiculously tanky really, really quickly (plus most people don't build pen)

{{champion:22}}

* Great poke between your W and longer AA range. Q is on permanently
* Your ult is on such a short cooldown.

{{champion:60}} 

* Build AP, Max W first, you have homing, spammable, high damage, AoE poke that can also check brush for you.
* Stun on a really short CD, and it's still really, really powerful (plus the missile speed buff makes hitting it really easy)
* Rappel makes you untargetable. Same as regular Elise, but much shorter CD.
* She just noms on people with spider Q and W.
* Elise has been out of the meta for a while, people forgot how to play against her (she was never super popular outside of competitive also)
{{champion:432}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3060}}  max E GG

I liked {{champion:3}} and {{champion:83}}. Galio's shield lasts longer than the cooldown, so even at rank 1 it's permanently on, his q and e already give him great chasing potential in normal games, in URF it's a lot of fun, and his ult is up every 30 seconds or so. Yorick can spam ghouls so that he always has the lifesteal ghoul up. Managed to win a couple of 2 v 1 with Yorick vs {{champion:120}} and {{champion:266}}. Once even had 2/3 health Aatrox lose to 300 health Yorick...because lifesteal ghouls.

> [{quoted}](name=Syn Zykan,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=yJm5uybK,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-04-02T17:09:25.909+0000)
>
> {{champion:15}} 
> Spell shield op, Level 1 poke/harass/waveclear is godlike, and her ult is on such a short cd you are pretty much always able to give a strong speed boost (Hecarim loves it too)

I saw someone playing her yesterday, but I hadn't really given it much thought, myself. Maybe I should try her. Siv is usually one of my favorite ADCs.
{{champion:5}} surprised no one mentioned him. His q has a 1.8 second cooldown, and his dash is 2 seconds at rank 5. w is always up. No one escapes and few can duel you.

{{champion:79}} has the strongest level 1 with endless bodyslams, and eventually his ult constantly helps you catch people out. The slight "issues" with him in urf is using your w before entering the fight, due to its channel time, and you can't really let your q charge up. But the body slam is all you really need, in the end.
{{champion:266}}
